question: Làm giảm bớt, làm dịu đi.
example: When people get lost, it’s comforting to know that their problems can be alleviated by looking at the sky.
english-definition: To make something bad such as pain or problems less severe.

question: Chiêm tinh học.
example: The Big Dipper, a constellation that is well known in astrology, appears to revolve around Polaris.
english-definition: The study of the movements and positions of the sun, moon, planets, and stars in the belief that they affect the character and lives of people.

question: Phân biệt, nhận ra sự khác biệt.
example: It’s not difficult to differentiate Polaris from other stars.
english-definition: To show or find the difference between things that are compared.

question: Làm gián đoạn, phá vỡ.
example: They could disrupt entire journeys by blocking the view of Polaris.
english-definition: To prevent something, especially a system, process, or event, from continuing as usual or as expected.

question: Phương trình, công thức.
example: As long as the equations weren’t erroneous, the results were very reliable.
english-definition: A mathematical statement that shows that two amounts are equal.

question: Phạm sai lầm, mắc lỗi.
example: A captain could err and make an inadvertent wrong turn.
english-definition: To make a mistake or to do something wrong.

question: Sai lầm, không chính xác.
example: As long as the equations weren’t erroneous, the results were very reliable.
english-definition: Wrong; incorrect.

question: Điên cuồng, cuống cuồng.
example: ...the frantic captain would have no way to improvise to get the ship back on the right course.
english-definition: Almost out of control because of extreme emotion, such as worry.

question: Thân tàu, thân thuyền.
example: From the top of their hulls, sailors would look for Polaris to figure out their place at sea.
english-definition: The main body of a ship or other vessel, including the bottom, sides, and deck.

question: Vô ý, không cố ý.
example: A captain could err and make an inadvertent wrong turn.
english-definition: Not intentional.

question: Ứng biến, làm tuỳ cơ ứng biến.
example: ...the frantic captain would have no way to improvise to get the ship back on the right course.
english-definition: To invent or make something, such as a speech or a meal, at the time when it is needed without already having planned it.

question: Vĩ độ.
example: They figured out the angle between the star and the horizon to determine their latitude.
english-definition: The position north or south of the equator measured from 0° to 90°.

question: Thủy thủ, người đi biển.
example: Before the invention of modern navigation tools, mariners relied on Polaris.
english-definition: A sailor.

question: Vô số, đám đông.
example: Among the multitude of stars in the universe, there are a couple that are of great importance to people on Earth.
english-definition: A large number of people or things.

question: Mối phiền toái, sự phiền phức.
example: To those who sail at night, volatile storms and dark clouds were more than nuisances.
english-definition: Something or someone that annoys you or causes trouble for you.

question: Sự lâu dài, sự vĩnh cửu.
example: The permanence of Polaris in the north sky has helped countless people find their destinations.
english-definition: The state of lasting for a long time or for all time.

question: Xoay quanh, quay tròn.
example: The Big Dipper, a constellation that is well known in astrology, appears to revolve around Polaris.
english-definition: To move or cause something to move around a central point or line.

question: Xoa dịu, làm dịu.
example: The mariner’s fears wouldn’t be soothed until the clouds cleared and Polaris came back into view.
english-definition: To make someone feel calm or less worried.

question: Bị mắc kẹt, bị bỏ lại.
example: The ship could become stranded at sea...
english-definition: Unable to leave somewhere because of a problem such as not having any transport or money.

question: Dễ thay đổi, không ổn định, dễ bay hơi.
example: To those who sail at night, volatile storms and dark clouds were more than nuisances.
english-definition: Likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly, especially by getting worse.
